dialogue.greeting: I'll be confiscating these illegal goods. Don't let me catch you again!
dialogue.who: I'm a guard.
dialogue.preference: I want to confiscate your goods.
dialogue.customQuestion: Why?
dialogue.customReply: Because.

dialogue.greeting: I need this more than you friend.
dialogue.who: I'm a thief.
dialogue.preference: Your coins.
dialogue.customQuestion: Why?
dialogue.customReply: Because

name: Edward
sceneResumeDialogue: Can you teach me to be a skilled merchant

dialogue.who: Edward, Boone Merchant Guild President.
dialogue.preference: Do you have any coins?
dialogue.customQuestion: Any advice for a fellow merchant?
dialogue.customReply: I recommend bartering in food until you get the hang of things. Find a farmer and buy as much as you can carry.

dialogue.who: Nevin Quinn, Clydesdale Merchant Guild President and librarian and historian and translator.
dialogue.preference: Uh... books I guess. Anything you have.
dialogue.customQuestion: Any advice for a fellow merchant?
dialogue.customReply: Bring a few barrels of ale with you whenever you visit Clydesdale. You'll find thirsty lips.

dialogue.who: Baldric, Riverton Merchant Guild President and Auctioneer.
dialogue.preference: I'm looking for rare paintings and jewelry that sells best at the auctions.
dialogue.customQuestion: Any advice for a fellow merchant?
dialogue.customReply: Riverton is called "The Meat Market" for its cheap meats from the central plains.

dialogue.who: Natia, Kai Merchant Guild President, but I'm actually from an outer island.
dialogue.preference: I am interested in all the gold you have.
dialogue.customQuestion: Any advice for a fellow merchant?
dialogue.customReply: Spices are lightweight and extremely valuable outside of Kai.

dialogue.who: Giles Cooper, Dauphine Coast Merchant Guild President and famed gambler.
dialogue.preference: Anything really. I just need to get rid of some of this copper.
dialogue.customQuestion: Any advice for a fellow merchant?
dialogue.customReply: Dauphine Coast is the home to many talented tailors, and cheap clothing prices.

dialogue.who: Faraday Casey, Warg Bay Merchant Guild President and the best Myth card player in the Realm.
dialogue.preference: Any card games?
dialogue.customQuestion: Any advice for a fellow merchant?
dialogue.customReply: Warg Bay is plentiful in cheap fish, if you're willing to carry it to your next market.

obtainableItems.tag: Win At Myth: Strategies to Win

dialogue.who: Sarah, Eldham Harbor Merchant Guild President and local Alchemist.
dialogue.preference: I am looking for botanicals for my botanicals.
dialogue.customQuestion: Any advice for a fellow merchant?
dialogue.customReply: The people of Eldham Harbor need more fruits from the south.

name: Yuma
sceneResumeDialogue: Do you still need help getting that amulet?

dialogue.who: Yuma, but I'm known as The Necromancer.
dialogue.preference: We need food for the winter, especially vegetables.
dialogue.customQuestion: Any advice for a fellow merchant?
dialogue.customReply: We need breads in Egilsdottir. We don't do much farming or baking here, and merchants rarely travel this far.

dialogue.who: Stuart, Ayr Merchant Guild President, although I'm better known as The Collector.
dialogue.preference: The church is very interested in statues. And therefore so am I.
dialogue.customQuestion: Any advice for a fellow merchant?
dialogue.customReply: Statues are in high demand in Ayr.

dialogue.who: Jazeer, Ingress Rock Merchant Guild President, although I have other titles...
dialogue.preference: I've always been fond of silver coins.
dialogue.customQuestion: Any advice for a fellow merchant?
dialogue.customReply: Jewelry is the currency of Ingress Rock. I suggest you buy some while you're here.

obtainableItems.tag: Presto Manifesto - A Guide to Fortuitism

dialogue.who: Darjus Zdanovic, local guild president. I work on paintings between customers.
dialogue.preference: Paints, especially blues and purples.
dialogue.customQuestion: Any advice for a fellow merchant?
dialogue.customReply: Hollow Lake has the finest cheeses in the realm, and for little cost.

name: Elric
sceneResumeDialogue: I have a mask for you

dialogue.who: Elric, Notting Hill Merchant Guild President. I specialize on statues and do a little sculpting myself.
dialogue.preference: I need good rocks for sculpting.
dialogue.customQuestion: Any advice for a fellow merchant?
dialogue.customReply: Notting creates some of the finest furniture in the realm. You just need the packhorses to carry them.

dialogue.who: Audric, the King of Coin.
dialogue.preference: I am the King of Coin. What do you think I want merchant?
dialogue.customQuestion: Any advice for a fellow merchant?
dialogue.customReply: You'll find no place in the realm where the coin is as mighty as it is here in Ascension.

obtainableItems.tag: Presto Manifesto - A Guide to Fortuitism

dialogue.who: Incantato, Enchanter and leader of the exiled who live at this Citadel.
dialogue.preference: I need gems, weapons, armor. They gain the most value from enchanting.
dialogue.customQuestion: Any advice for a fellow merchant?
dialogue.customReply: Most of the magic items you've ever touched was created in this very Citadel. This is the most direct place to buy them.

dialogue.who: Kris, Kazuujan Merchant Guild President, Blacksmith, and Friend of the Dragon.
dialogue.preference: There is a metal called nova. It has magical properties that make it very lightweight. I can buy all the nova you bring me.
dialogue.customQuestion: Any advice for a fellow merchant?
dialogue.customReply: Because the Dragon pays his advisors and armies in gold, gold is not worth quite as much in Kazuujan.

dialogue.who: Zah, Oasis of Refuge Merchant Guild President. I'm one of the few orcs born on this side of the desert.
dialogue.preference: Do you have any flails or maces?
dialogue.customQuestion: Any advice for a fellow merchant?
dialogue.customReply: This far west, monster parts are as common as the wind itself.

dialogue.who: Ryuko, Shikyomo Merchant Guild President.
dialogue.preference: Have you brought any weapons with you?
dialogue.customQuestion: Any advice for a fellow merchant?
dialogue.customReply: Smuggle in all the coin and weapons you can. They are worth a lot in the black market here.
dialogue.jobSuccess: I've brought the best Jewels on the Kaichi Islands
dialogue.jobFailure: We hit rough waters and the shipment sank. My apologies.

dialogue.who: Sam, Traveling Merchant.
dialogue.preference: Any silver coins?
dialogue.customQuestion: Any advice for a fellow merchant?
dialogue.customReply: Never buy coin from a merchant. Nobles and soldiers are much looser with their coin.

dialogue.who: Estrilda, Traveling Merchant.
dialogue.preference: Packs and sacks.
dialogue.customQuestion: Any advice for a fellow merchant?
dialogue.customReply: Nearly everybody has something they can sell you at a discount.

dialogue.who: Henry Rowing, Traveling Merchant.
dialogue.preference: Do you have any secure chests?
dialogue.customQuestion: Any advice for a fellow merchant?
dialogue.customReply: Buying in bulk will bring better prices.

dialogue.who: Yoshimasa, Traveling Merchant.
dialogue.preference: I am looking for some well priced gems.
dialogue.customQuestion: Any advice for a fellow merchant?
dialogue.customReply: Put your wealth into jewelry and spices to travel light and lessen your tolls.
dialogue.jobSuccess: Here are the finest fabrics Shikyomo has to offer.

dialogue.who: Penny. Traveling merchant from Clydesdale.
dialogue.preference: Have any packs or sacks?
dialogue.customQuestion: Any advice for a fellow merchant?
dialogue.customReply: Sacks are lighter than crates and barrels.

dialogue.who: Rowan Moss. Traveling merchant.
dialogue.preference: I need a new cart.
dialogue.customQuestion: Any advice for a fellow merchant?
dialogue.customReply: Always be flipping your inventory. If you're not selling, you're not making money.

dialogue.who: Odo, Traveling Merchant.
dialogue.preference: Do you have any glyph stones?
dialogue.customQuestion: Any advice for a fellow merchant?
dialogue.customReply: Conceal items you aren't ready to sell.

obtainableItems.tag: Presto Manifesto - A Guide to Fortuitism

dialogue.who: Syrilla. I'm a traveling merchant.
dialogue.preference: Chests and crates.
dialogue.customQuestion: Any advice for a fellow merchant?
dialogue.customReply: Find yourself a map to the Citadel, and bring things for the Enchanter.

obtainableItems.tag: Presto Manifesto - A Guide to Fortuitism

dialogue.who: Saida. I'm a fabric merchant.
dialogue.preference: Do you have any cotton?
dialogue.customQuestion: Any advice for a fellow merchant?
dialogue.customReply: People will pay more for things only found in foreign places.

dialogue.who: Edwin. Been a traveling merchant all my life.
dialogue.preference: I could use a new packhorse.
dialogue.customQuestion: Any advice for a fellow merchant?
dialogue.customReply: A smaller packhorse is a better deal, but having too many makes travel expensive.

dialogue.who: Annora. Can you spare anything to eat?
dialogue.preference: Could you spare some food?
dialogue.customQuestion: Why have you fallen on hard times?
dialogue.customReply: I was born into hard times.
dialogue.beg: I can not afford to pay? Could I please have this kind Merchant?

dialogue.who: Matilda. I cook for the king and many other nobles in Notting.
dialogue.preference: I need fruits and veggies for my stews.
dialogue.customQuestion: What is the Notting Royalty like?
dialogue.customReply: Let's just say I'm not optimistic of our future.

dialogue.who: Robin, best fletcher in Notting.
dialogue.preference: Do you have any shields?
dialogue.customQuestion: What is the best kind of arrow
dialogue.customReply: In my opinion, nothing compares with the heartwood arrows they have up north in the Fray.

dialogue.who: Skye Campbell. I'm a flourist for the church.
dialogue.preference: Flowers, but they have to be divine.
dialogue.customQuestion: Advice on buying flowers?
dialogue.customReply: Prices are lowest during Seed and increase as the End of Harvest Festival approaches.

dialogue.who: Zalia. Just a wanderer in search of things that are... fantastical.
dialogue.preference: Do you have any amulets?
dialogue.customQuestion: Are you seeking magic items?
dialogue.customReply: I won't say yes, but if you have something to show me, I'll keep it our secret.

dialogue.who: Katherine Notting of Notting Hill.
dialogue.preference: Our home could use some furniture.
dialogue.customQuestion: What do you think about Notting Hill?
dialogue.customReply: Some nobles prefer Ascension, but that place lacks the distinguished history we have on this famous little hill.

dialogue.who: Ryane Fitzpatrick, Farmer from south of Ayr.
dialogue.preference: Bring any fruit from the south merchant?
dialogue.customQuestion: What do you think about Ayr?
dialogue.customReply: The winters are unbearable, but come harvest time Ayr can be a beautiful place.

dialogue.who: Susanna Taylor, Seamstress from Duaphine Coast.
dialogue.preference: I can never have too many fabrics.
dialogue.customQuestion: Where do you get your fabrics from?
dialogue.customReply: I depend on merchants like yourself, but the exotic fabrics come through Ingress Rock.

dialogue.maskRequested: This mask is for the Masquerade Ball. It is not for sale.
dialogue.who: William Rockly, Nobleman of Boone.
dialogue.preference: I could use a new statue for my home.
dialogue.customQuestion: How does one become a nobleman?
dialogue.customReply: It's pretty simple actually. Own land.

dialogue.who: George Smith, Blacksmith from Boone.
dialogue.preference: A blacksmith is always in need of ore.
dialogue.customQuestion: Where is the best place to go for ore and gems?
dialogue.customReply: Anywhere with mountains. Ayr, Kazuujan, Ingress Rock, even Kai.

dialogue.who: Hart Kitchener, I'm a butcher. Finest meats you'll find anywhere.
dialogue.preference: I always need livestock.
dialogue.customQuestion: How is the life of a butcher?
dialogue.customReply: I used to be a soldier. Being a butcher doesn't pay as well, but it's a hell of a lot less deadly.

dialogue.who: Sam Fisher. I have fished the northern waters for half a century.
dialogue.preference: Do you have any shoes?
dialogue.customQuestion: Is it difficult fishing at your age?
dialogue.customReply: Fishing is difficult at any age.

dialogue.maskRequested: This mask is for my performance at the Masquerade Ball. I really can't sell it.
dialogue.who: Terric Nash. I'm a jester for the wealthy.
dialogue.preference: Do you have any colorful clothes fit for a Jester?
dialogue.customQuestion: Does the king pay you well?
dialogue.customReply: The king only provides a place to sleep, but sometimes a vassal or foreign ruler will demonstrate their wealth by showering me with coins.

dialogue.who: Joseph, Miner.
dialogue.preference: Gloves, laterns, shovels and picks. Anything useful in the mines really.
dialogue.customQuestion: Where should I travel for cheap gems?
dialogue.customReply: West of Notting Hill is a city called Kazuujan. I have heard rare gems are as common as granite rocks.

dialogue.maskRequested: Ah, this is my mask for the Masquerade Ball. I'm sorry but I won't be selling it.
dialogue.who: Roark Sheehan, nobleman of The Fray.
dialogue.preference: Any good meats?
dialogue.customQuestion: What do you think about the king?
dialogue.customReply: He does exactly what he needs to do, which is whatever the church tell him to.

dialogue.who: Blacwin Gregory, Knight for the Notting Dynasty.
dialogue.preference: I need stronger armor.
dialogue.customQuestion: How goes the war?
dialogue.customReply: Notting is fielding the greatest armies the realm has ever seen. I'm sure the war will be over by the new year.

dialogue.who: Adam, Soldier for Notting.
dialogue.preference: We need swords for the new soldiers. Any kind will do.
dialogue.customQuestion: How goes the war?
dialogue.customReply: The Redlands aren't very interested in the swamps of Boone. Honestly Notting Hill isn't either.

dialogue.who: Mathew, Soldier for Notting.
dialogue.preference: I could use some games to pass the time.
dialogue.customQuestion: How goes the war?
dialogue.customReply: Warg Bay has been importing weapons from the western nations. I'm not sure how to even use half of these things.

dialogue.who: John. I'm a Farmer here in Boone.
dialogue.preference: I could use some gloves and boots.
dialogue.customQuestion: When is the best time to buy food?
dialogue.customReply: The season of Harvest of course. Everything from fruits and veggies to fish is cheaper during Harvest.

dialogue.who: Jack Bennett, Sailor.
dialogue.preference: Ale, mead, wine. I'm not picky.
dialogue.customQuestion: What are the major ports?
dialogue.customReply: Ascension is the wealthiest port, but I suspect more weight passes through Ingress Rock than anywhere else.
dialogue.jobSuccess: I've brought your spices.
dialogue.jobFailure: I was in a tough position and had to sell the spices to make it back.

dialogue.who: Pauric Martin, Priest for the Divinity.
dialogue.preference: You should make a donation to the church.
dialogue.customQuestion: Why are monster parts illegal?
dialogue.customReply: The last thing we need are people breeding monsters for coin.
dialogue.beg: I think you should provide this as a donation to the church, don't you?

dialogue.who: Arthur Godsen, Knight for the Redlands Kingdom.
dialogue.preference: I need a sword worthy of the Redlands name.
dialogue.customQuestion: How goes the war?
dialogue.customReply: The war is the least of our problems. Ensuring the taxes continue to flow to the crown is the more important objective.

dialogue.who: Kaitlyn O'Callaghan. I'm an alchemist with potions to sell.
dialogue.preference: I'm looking for a good book. Let me know if you find an interesting one.
dialogue.customQuestion: How do you make potions without monster parts?
dialogue.customReply: Monster parts are illegal, but you can find them if you know where to look, or rather who to barter with...

dialogue.who: Ronald Hughes, Soldier for the Redlands.
dialogue.preference: A strong drink and a savoury meat.
dialogue.customQuestion: How goes the war?
dialogue.customReply: Riverton is mostly used to distribute supplies to the armies. I spend most of my day loading and unloading crates.

dialogue.who: Randall Shaw, Soldier for the Redlands.
dialogue.preference: We need helmets and breastplates.
dialogue.customQuestion: How goes the war?
dialogue.customReply: Dauphine Coast is currently hosting the largest fleet assembled since the war of Revival. I don't think Notting has a chance.

dialogue.who: Mary, Baker of Boone.
dialogue.preference: Do you have any Cinnamon or Nutmeg?
dialogue.customQuestion: What do you think about Boone?
dialogue.customReply: It's a nice town to make a living, but not one to make a fortune.

dialogue.who: Sebastian. Just an honest thief.
dialogue.preference: I have a taste for small but sharp daggers.
dialogue.customQuestion: What is an honest thief?
dialogue.customReply: A thief who knows when the truth is the best lie.
dialogue.jobSuccess: I've got the goods.
dialogue.jobFailure: I ain't got nothing for you.

dialogue.who: Ernald Payne. People come from both Notting and Redlands to be buried in Hollow Lake.
dialogue.preference: I need solutions and aromatics for my customers.
dialogue.customQuestion: Why is Hollow Lake a popular place to be buried?
dialogue.customReply: Notting the First was buried here. Once a few famous people are in a graveyard, a few feet of dirt becomes priceless.

dialogue.who: Eve, Assassin for hire.
dialogue.preference: I am looking for the potions and poisons.
dialogue.customQuestion: How much coin does an assassin make?
dialogue.customReply: The coin is bountiful, but work is hard to find and failure is never an option.

dialogue.who: Ascilia The White, sorceress of entropy magic.
dialogue.preference: Bring me any powerful runes you find Merchant.
dialogue.customQuestion: How powerful is entropy magic?
dialogue.customReply: It destroyed the realm long ago. Entire armies can be destroyed by a powerful enough practitioner.

dialogue.who: Ku. Warrior for those that need a hero. Mercenary for those who can afford a hero.
dialogue.preference: I think I could carry a few more war hammers.
dialogue.customQuestion: Why do you use war hammers?
dialogue.customReply: Some monsters can't be cut. They must be crushed.
dialogue.jobSuccess: I have a collection of Dragon Scales.
dialogue.jobFailure: The dragons nearly killed me. I was lucky to get back alive.

dialogue.who: Pedal. I'm a bard, a poet, and a painter.
dialogue.preference: I could use several paints for my next project.
dialogue.customQuestion: How do you make your coin?
dialogue.customReply: The wealthy are obsessed with power, and spectacle. I thrive off the later.

dialogue.who: Alison Sweeney. I farm the fields of The Fray.
dialogue.preference: Do you have any seeds from far away?
dialogue.customQuestion: How do you like it in Clydesdale?
dialogue.customReply: I grew up in Ayr. I found Clydesdale to have warmer suns and happier folk.

dialogue.who: Petronilla. I am a healer.
dialogue.preference: Do you have any pottery for sale?
dialogue.customQuestion: Where did you learn to become a healer?
dialogue.customReply: There is a woman in the far north western reaches of the Realm. She is considered a miracle worker.

dialogue.who: Isabella Knightly of Ascension, and proud mother of two knights.
dialogue.preference: I think swords are beautiful. Let me know if you find anything truly special.
dialogue.customQuestion: What do you think of Ascension?
dialogue.customReply: Ascension was a small village only a few hundred years ago. Incredible what a decent port can bring.

dialogue.who: Catriona, Devote of Divinity.
dialogue.preference: You should make a donation to the church merchant.
dialogue.customQuestion: Why are monster parts illegal?
dialogue.customReply: I believe it is to return The Fray to the way things were before the holy war against magic.
dialogue.beg: Could you make a charitable donation to the church Merchant?

dialogue.who: Marsilia. I'm a servant for the Notting Royals.
dialogue.preference: We need more tableware for the manor.
dialogue.customQuestion: Does the royalty treat you well?
dialogue.customReply: Not at all, but they do pay me quite well. And I make some fabrics on the side.

dialogue.who: Sato. Most skilled thief in Shikyomo or Ascension.
dialogue.preference: I just need someone to purchase my magic items.
dialogue.customQuestion: Do you prefer Shikyomo or Ascension?
dialogue.customReply: I only come to Ascension to steal what I can and bring it back to my family in Shikyomo.
dialogue.jobSuccess: Easiest job I've ever had.
dialogue.jobFailure: I was caught crossing into the Redlands. Lucky I'm not in jail.

dialogue.who: Collin. Ex thief. I've changed my ways and pay my way.
dialogue.preference: Anything to drink?
dialogue.customQuestion: Why did you quit being a thief?
dialogue.customReply: A few too many close calls. I'm now too old to be running for my life.

dialogue.who: Toya. I'm a Carpenter.
dialogue.preference: Coins. Silver ideally.
dialogue.customQuestion: Where is a good market to sell furniture?
dialogue.customReply: Ascension is full of nobles with too much room in their homes.

dialogue.who: David, a simple farmer just north of Warg Bay.
dialogue.preference: I need a new packhorse for my farm.
dialogue.customQuestion: What do you think of Warg Bay?
dialogue.customReply: There is too much drink and coin flowing in this town, brings nothing but trouble to us.

dialogue.who: Tavis Kennedy, Knight for The Fray.
dialogue.preference: I need a new horse.
dialogue.customQuestion: Will The Fray get involved in the war.
dialogue.customReply: I doubt it. Our royal family has close ties to the Nottings, but our cities depends on trade with the Redlands.

dialogue.who: Rory McLoughlin, Soldier for The Fray.
dialogue.preference: We are building a ship and will buy as much wood as you can supply.
dialogue.customQuestion: Will The Fray get involved in the war?
dialogue.customReply: If we do, we will dominate the seas, and overwhelm anyone who stands before us.

dialogue.who: Clyde O'Connor, Soldier for The Fray.
dialogue.preference: Do you have any seafood merchant?
dialogue.customQuestion: Will The Fray get involved in the war?
dialogue.customReply: I sure hope not. I would hate to leave my family to fight for another kingdom.

dialogue.who: Boyd O'Connell. I'm a fletcher who makes the finest arrows you've ever had shot at you.
dialogue.preference: Have any wood?
dialogue.customQuestion: Are you good with a bow yourself?
dialogue.customReply: In competiton, I'm undefeated. In battle, things are a bit more difficult.

dialogue.maskRequested: This mask is not for sale. It is my ticket for the Masquerade Ball, and I wouldn't miss that for the world.
dialogue.who: Nicholas Godfrey. Nobleman and art collector.
dialogue.preference: I am a connoisseur of fine art.
dialogue.customQuestion: Who is your favorite artist
dialogue.customReply: Simon Crowell truly transcends the medium and escapes the canvas and enters the soul. So perhaps him.

dialogue.who: Mackenzie from Ayr. I travel the realm in search of adventure and coin.
dialogue.preference: A strong sword I can trust with my life.
dialogue.customQuestion: Is there not adventure and coin in Ayr
dialogue.customReply: Well there's coin alright, but The Fray doesn't even allow monster parts, although it's not uncommon for it to be smuggled in.

dialogue.who: Rawl The White Wizard?
dialogue.preference: Do you have any runes by chance?
dialogue.customQuestion: How does magic work?
dialogue.customReply: There are six schools. Enchanting, Conjuration, Necromancy, Illusion, Entropy, Revision. I only know Revision, and it would take me many years to explain.

dialogue.who: Black Rock.
dialogue.preference: War hammers. Big ones.
dialogue.customQuestion: Why do they call you black rock?
dialogue.customReply: Ingress Rock is a black rock. But being named Ingress Rock got confusing.
dialogue.jobSuccess: Here.

dialogue.who: Nahoko. I'm a farmer and mother.
dialogue.preference: What clothing do you have?
dialogue.customQuestion: What do you think of Shikyomo?
dialogue.customReply: I have never been off the island, but I couldn't imagine living with the war you have on the mainland.

dialogue.who: Esther, best blacksmith in town.
dialogue.preference: Do you have any lead ore?
dialogue.customQuestion: Who is the best blacksmith in the realm?
dialogue.customReply: Kris from Kazuujan is a master of steel, and a funny fellow too, once you get to know him.

dialogue.who: Kella Flynn. I run The Drunken Shoes Inn and Tavern.
dialogue.preference: I need more chairs and tables for tavern.
dialogue.customQuestion: Why do they call it the Drunken Shoes?
dialogue.customReply: It's an old joke in Clydesdale that when a man here stumbles, it's not him that's drunk, but the shoes.

dialogue.who: Miriam. I'm a Cartographer. Some say the realm is already mapped enough, but I disagree.
dialogue.preference: Do you have any glyph stones?
dialogue.customQuestion: What is left to be mapped?
dialogue.customReply: West of the desert is too treacherous. North of Ayr is steep and frozen. But the ocean brings the greatest mystery to me.

dialogue.who: Tamar, farmer from a nearby island.
dialogue.preference: I'm looking for chairs and tables.
dialogue.customQuestion: How many islands are there?
dialogue.customReply: There are three major islands, and six minor islands, as represented on our shared flag.

dialogue.who: Fiona O'Doherty, Devote of Divinity.
dialogue.preference: You should make a donation to the church merchant.
dialogue.customQuestion: Why are monster parts illegal?
dialogue.customReply: You should not question the church.
dialogue.beg: Such a greedy thing to ask. Save your soul and donate this in the name of the Revival.

dialogue.who: Dead Red Sadie. I assure you the stories you've heard are only half true.
dialogue.preference: Give me something strong to drink.
dialogue.customQuestion: Are you a pirate?
dialogue.customReply: I am a privateer. I operate legally, for the most part.
dialogue.jobSuccess: Another rollicking success.
dialogue.jobFailure: They were sailing in fleets, we had no chance against those numbers.

name: Kaiyo
sceneResumeDialogue: I want to turn in a resistance member

dialogue.who: Kaiyo, Shikyomo Guard and Soldier.
dialogue.preference: Have you brought any fabrics with you?
dialogue.customQuestion: How was the revolution?
dialogue.customReply: Terrible. People are brazenly exchanging coins and bartering food. I'm only here to keep the peace.

dialogue.who: Satoshi. Humble monk and believer in the power of Mysticism.
dialogue.preference: I need nothing but a fruit to eat.
dialogue.customQuestion: What is Mysticism?
dialogue.customReply: After the Revival, my people decided to look inwards for meaning. Mysticism is the result of generations of thought.
dialogue.beg: What is given for free, is returned three-fold.

dialogue.maskRequested: This mask is a ticket for the Masquerade Ball, which as Diplomat is important I attend.
dialogue.who: Hamilton Clarke. I'm a diplomat for Notting.
dialogue.preference: I collect coat of arms, useful for a diplomat.
dialogue.customQuestion: Will there be peace in the war?
dialogue.customReply: Too many lords refuse to return to Notting while Ascension offers them superior trading opportunities.

dialogue.who: Jaime Forrester, lumberjack from the woods outside of town.
dialogue.preference: Any axes you have.
dialogue.customQuestion: Is there much demand for wood?
dialogue.customReply: Eldham is making ships for both sides of the war. I have been more busy than ever.

dialogue.who: Barnabas, I mine the mountains that separate the east and west.
dialogue.preference: Have any quality shovels merchant?
dialogue.customQuestion: What other mountains have valuable jewels?
dialogue.customReply: The only place that might rival Kazuujan are the mountains of Ayr.

name: Ronin
sceneResumeDialogue: I want to turn in a resistance member

dialogue.who: Ronin, Shikyomo Guard and Soldier.
dialogue.preference: Any remedies?
dialogue.customQuestion: How was the revolution?
dialogue.customReply: I had to choose between my fellow guards and my own neighbors. Both took heavy losses.

name: Kano
sceneResumeDialogue: I want to turn in a resistance member

dialogue.who: Kano, Shikyomo Guard and Soldier.
dialogue.preference: Got anything to drink?
dialogue.customQuestion: How was the revolution?
dialogue.customReply: I wouldn't know. I spent the whole time camping in the woods. Great timing I guess...

dialogue.who: Jalu, Priestess for the Kai Unity Ceremony.
dialogue.preference: Flowers are an important part of every ceremony in Kai.
dialogue.customQuestion: What is your role in the Kai Unity Ceremony?
dialogue.customReply: I uphold the traditions, but more importantly the integrity to ensure the rightful person becomes Unity Chief.

obtainableItems.tag: The 131 Acts of Conjure: An academic analysis

dialogue.who: Alexandria, Queen of the Redlands.
dialogue.preference: We need crates and barrels for the war with the Nottings.
dialogue.customQuestion: What do you think of the war?
dialogue.customReply: I don't concern myself with wars. There are more important matters happening in the realm.

dialogue.maskRequested: This mask is for the Masquerade Ball. Even as King, I must also participate.
dialogue.who: Christoph the Sixth, King of the Notting Dynasty.
dialogue.preference: I require strong horses for the war.
dialogue.customQuestion: What do you think of the war?
dialogue.customReply: If we do not assert the crown, it will mean nothing.

dialogue.who: David the Second. The King of Ascension. Welcome to Ascension merchant.
dialogue.preference: I am looking to fill a new room in the castle with paintings.
dialogue.customQuestion: What do you think of the war?
dialogue.customReply: The lords have a right to choose their ruler. The age of Notting is coming to an end from their own doing.

dialogue.who: I am Saku Nimoto, king of this island of the north.
dialogue.preference: Do you have rings?
dialogue.customQuestion: Why is trading food illegal in Shikyomo?
dialogue.customReply: It's to stop merchants like yourself from running off with our food. We have our priorites straight in Kaichi.

dialogue.who: Pontiff Luke the Fifth.
dialogue.preference: You should make a donation to the church.
dialogue.customQuestion: Why are monster parts illegal in The Fray?
dialogue.customReply: The monsters were created as our enemies in the war of revival. They are a shame upon the realm.
dialogue.beg: In the name of the pontiff and the revival that set us free from tyranny, donate this to the church. We need everything we can get.

dialogue.who: Robert the Second, King of The Fray.
dialogue.preference: Do you have any deserts?
dialogue.customQuestion: Why are monster parts illegal in The Fray?
dialogue.customReply: Everything the church declares sinful, the king must declare illegal, as it should be.

dialogue.who: Robert the Third, Prince of The Fray.
dialogue.preference: Have anything good to drink?
dialogue.customQuestion: What kind of responsibilities does the prince have?
dialogue.customReply: Find a wife of presigious background and strategic value. That's pretty much it until a few people die.

dialogue.who: Clementine, the Princess of Notting.
dialogue.preference: We need statues and furniture for our castle.
dialogue.customQuestion: What do you think of the war?
dialogue.customReply: We must find a peace, but it must be on our terms, less any more lords change their allegiance.

dialogue.who: Koda, Cheif of Kai Island and Voice of the Island Kingdom.
dialogue.preference: Gold. No silver or copper.
dialogue.customQuestion: Voice of the Island Kingdom. Does that make you a king?
dialogue.customReply: The islands rule themselves. My job is only to speak to the other kingdoms, mostly matters of trade.

dialogue.who: Eliza, The Belly Dancer of Ingress Rock.
dialogue.preference: Do you have any fine jewelry?
dialogue.customQuestion: How do you like Ingress Rock?
dialogue.customReply: Not even Ascension bustles like Ingress Rock can when the ships roll in.

dialogue.who: Kas, best blacksmith in Kai.
dialogue.preference: Up north there is a metal called plazer. Strongest thing in the realm. Think you could bring me some?
dialogue.customQuestion: How are the ores in the Kai mountains.
dialogue.customReply: The mountains here have plenty of gems and crystals, but is lacking in the ores a blacksmith cares about.

dialogue.who: Alma, Seer of Hollow Lake.
dialogue.preference: Flowers bring me great joy.
dialogue.customQuestion: What does my future hold?
dialogue.customReply: You will find great wealth, but you will discover coin is not enough to reach your destiny.

dialogue.who: Jai. I hunt around these islands.
dialogue.preference: Do you have any quality bows?
dialogue.customQuestion: Are there monsters on Kai?
dialogue.customReply: The sea has protected us from most, but many amphibian monsters plague remote parts of the islands.

dialogue.who: Lizzie. Finest harlot in the city.
dialogue.preference: Are you selling any aromatics?
dialogue.customQuestion: How much do you charge?
dialogue.customReply: I don't go advertising my prices in the townsquare.

dialogue.who: I'm a humble farmer named Dea.
dialogue.preference: Furniture for my family.
dialogue.customQuestion: How do you like Kai?
dialogue.customReply: The food grows itself on Kai, and the water between the islands do not separate us.

dialogue.who: Daichi. I am a blacksmith here. I can make anything you can think of.
dialogue.preference: Tin is rare in our mountains, so I depend on merchants to bring me whatever they can.
dialogue.customQuestion: Is there a lot of demand for weapons in Shikyomo?
dialogue.customReply: Weapons are illegal. However Ryuko has been placing enough orders to keep me busy.
dialogue.jobSuccess: Here are ingots from the blacksmiths of the Kaichi Islands.
dialogue.jobFailure: We ship hit rocks. The ingots were too heavy to be rescued.

dialogue.who: Frederick, the Black Knight. I pledge my loyalty not to a king but to where it is most needed.
dialogue.preference: Magical runes.
dialogue.customQuestion: When did you become the black knight?
dialogue.customReply: With the realm at war with itself, the realm needs an impartial champion.
dialogue.jobSuccess: The enemy is defeated.
dialogue.jobFailure: I have failed. I met my match and must now train.

dialogue.who: Jon. I'm a ditcher. That means I dig ditches for the Redlands.
dialogue.preference: Do you have shovels?
dialogue.customQuestion: Are rocks really worth anything?
dialogue.customReply: Not to me. Perhaps to a sculpter or mason or madman.

dialogue.who: Ano. I fish the waters of the Kai.
dialogue.preference: I'd trade some fish for meats.
dialogue.customQuestion: What is the cheapest fish?
dialogue.customReply: Anchovy would be my answer. You can usually buy a few for a single coin.

dialogue.who: Paul, Bard from Riverton. I've been all over the realm from foggy Fray ports to dazzling desert dunes.
dialogue.preference: I enjoy a good book.
dialogue.customQuestion: What's your favorite town?
dialogue.customReply: Clydesdale up north is the friendliest place in the realm for travelers.

dialogue.maskRequested: I'm sorry, but I can't attend the Masquerade Ball without this mask.
dialogue.who: Tua, Nobleman of Kai.
dialogue.preference: Do you have nuts?
dialogue.customQuestion: Who do you think will win Unity Chief?
dialogue.customReply: Natia is the only one challenging for Unity Chief. I wish her the best, but many generations have tried and failed before her.

dialogue.who: Long Legs Logan, who's asking?
dialogue.preference: Have any ale?
dialogue.customQuestion: Are you a pirate?
dialogue.customReply: Mind your own business Merchant.
dialogue.jobSuccess: They were no match for the likes of Long Legs Logan and his crew!
dialogue.jobFailure: My crew threw me overboard. I deserved it to be fair.

dialogue.who: Volkan. I travel to areas suffering from plagues to provide my services.
dialogue.preference: I require a variety of carefully mixed solutions.
dialogue.customQuestion: What causes plagues?
dialogue.customReply: Plagues are gods tool for punishing sin. The only prevention is greater devotion.

dialogue.who: La'akea, Spearman for Kai.
dialogue.preference: Do you have any quality spears?
dialogue.customQuestion: Do the islands have wars?
dialogue.customReply: Sometimes island chiefs may threaten each other, but there has not been war on the islands since the Revival.

dialogue.who: Cyrilla Smith, Blacksmith of Hollow Lake.
dialogue.preference: Silver. Ore, ingots, kitchenware, whatever you have.
dialogue.customQuestion: What is the most expensive type of ingot?
dialogue.customReply: Gold of course, but other than that, Nova isn't that far behind.

dialogue.who: Ahnah. I take care of the children of the village.
dialogue.preference: Any breads?
dialogue.customQuestion: Is it dangerous living in such a cold place?
dialogue.customReply: The Necromancer keeps us safe.

dialogue.who: Tapeesa. I make clothes for the village.
dialogue.preference: Do you have any fabrics?
dialogue.customQuestion: How many layers of clothes does it take to stay warm  here?
dialogue.customReply: There is no such thing as warm in Egilsdóttir. But four layers will keep you alive.

dialogue.who: Uki. Trapper for the village.
dialogue.preference: Do you have any arrows or spears?
dialogue.customQuestion: Are there monsters this far north?
dialogue.customReply: There are, but they are not interested in our village.

dialogue.who: Mara. As you may be able to see, and smell, I am undead. The necromancer gave me a second chance.
dialogue.preference: I need aromatics. It helps cover the smell.
dialogue.customQuestion: Have you considered leaving Egilsdóttir?
dialogue.customReply: Egilsdóttir is the only place a dead person is just another person.

dialogue.who: Anubis. I died long ago, but the Necromancer recently gave me a second chance.
dialogue.preference: Do you have any milk?
dialogue.customQuestion: What is it like being a skeleton?
dialogue.customReply: Miserable. Nearly as bad as being a human.

dialogue.who: Hilda. I'm a farmer in Hollow Lake.
dialogue.preference: Do you have plates or other items for my house?
dialogue.customQuestion: How do you like Hollow Lake?
dialogue.customReply: It is a quiet village, fair climate for a farmer, and far from the war.

dialogue.who: Panuk. I'm an Ice Fisher of Egilsdottir Lake.
dialogue.preference: Do you have any fruits or veggies?
dialogue.customQuestion: Does the lake ever thaw?
dialogue.customReply: No, but I do walk softer on the ice during the warmer seasons.

dialogue.who: Yuka. I'm a hunter of the frozen tundra that surrounds the village.
dialogue.preference: I am always running out of arrows.
dialogue.customQuestion: Do you like the cold?
dialogue.customReply: Not often, but when I visited the south, I longed to be back home at this frozen lake.

dialogue.who: Toklo. I make tools for the village.
dialogue.preference: Do you have any supplies?
dialogue.customQuestion: What do you think of Egilsdóttir?
dialogue.customReply: I have never left our village. The stories I hear from those that do make me happy to call this place home.

dialogue.who: Sanford. I herd several flocks of animals just outside of Clydesdale.
dialogue.preference: Do you have any fruit?
dialogue.customQuestion: Does herding pay well?
dialogue.customReply: Yes. However unlike a farmer, someone can walk away with what I own rather easily.

dialogue.greeting: Welcome to Danburg. I'm the Quartermaster. Everything bought and sold goes through me.
dialogue.who: Cooper, Quartermaster of Danburg Fortress.
dialogue.preference: We need to bulk up on food for any upcoming seige we may suffer.
dialogue.customQuestion: How is the war going?
dialogue.customReply: The war is going alright. That's the only thing it does. It keeps going and I don't see it ending anytime soon.

dialogue.greeting: Welcome to Hartford. I'm the Quartermaster. Everything bought and sold goes through me.
dialogue.who: Hystern, Quartermaster of Hartford Stronghold.
dialogue.preference: We don't have enough gravestones for all the losses we've suffered.
dialogue.customQuestion: How is the war going?
dialogue.customReply: Notting is destinated to win and reunite the realm. It is only a matter of time.

dialogue.greeting: Welcome to Pembran. I'm the Quartermaster. Everything bought and sold goes through me.
dialogue.who: Eric, Quartermaster of Pembran Castle.
dialogue.preference: We need the help of potions and remedies if we are to weather this war to the end.
dialogue.customQuestion: How is the war going?
dialogue.customReply: I am sorry, but I can't talk about the war with merchants.

dialogue.greeting: Welcome to Danburg. I'm the Quartermaster. Everything bought and sold goes through me.
dialogue.who: Micheal, Quartermaster of Danburg Fortress.
dialogue.preference: We don't have enough armor for all the soldiers.
dialogue.customQuestion: How is the war going?
dialogue.customReply: Now that we've taken Danburg, I expect Notting to surrender any day now.

dialogue.greeting: Welcome to Hartford. I'm the Quartermaster. Everything bought and sold goes through me.
dialogue.who: Drake, Quartermaster of Hartford Stronghold.
dialogue.preference: Logistics is the key to victory. We need packhorses, carts, barrels and crates.
dialogue.customQuestion: How is the war going?
dialogue.customReply: That is secret information merchant. Mind your own business.

dialogue.greeting: Welcome to Pembran. I'm the Quartermaster. Everything bought and sold goes through me.
dialogue.who: Potter, Quartermaster of Pembran Castle.
dialogue.preference: We need more weapons! Swords, bows, and arrows especially.
dialogue.customQuestion: How is the war going?
dialogue.customReply: Why do you want to know? Are you a spy? I should hope not.

dialogue.who: Kyra. I've been a blacksmith since Robert the First was king for the Fray.
dialogue.preference: I need silver ingots, but I could also melt silver kitchenware if you have any.
dialogue.customQuestion: What kind of ore are in the mountains Loot?
dialogue.customReply: The mountains of Ayr are famous for rare plazer ore. Makes for incredibly strong weapons and armor.

dialogue.who: Paisley. I'm a blacksmith and jeweler, specializing in working with plazer.
dialogue.preference: Do you have any copper? Even copper coins would work.
dialogue.customQuestion: What is plazer?
dialogue.customReply: Plazer is a type of ore found only in the mountains of  Ayr. It is as strong as it is rare.

dialogue.who: Erika. I'm a blacksmith, and a damn good one.
dialogue.preference: Tin ore. Tin ingots. I'll pay well for either.
dialogue.customQuestion: How much cheaper is ore than ingots?
dialogue.customReply: Oh I'd say a chunk of iron ore is about a tenth the price of an iron ingot.

dialogue.who: Lyzia. I'm a master of the art of Conjur, the most dangerous of the magical arts.
dialogue.preference: I will pay top price for any monster parts you bring me.
dialogue.customQuestion: What makes conjur dangerous?
dialogue.customReply: Summoning powerful beasts is easy, controlling them is something few are capable of.

dialogue.who: Alvezi. I'm an elven fletcher who specializes in powerful arrows.
dialogue.preference: Can you bring me any amulets?
dialogue.customQuestion: Why do elves prefer bow and arrow over swords?
dialogue.customReply: Elves live for centuries, long enough to perfect the art of the bow.

dialogue.who: Tyzel. I'm the guard of the Citadel.
dialogue.preference: The Citadel Guard requires more magical staffs. We must be ready for the day when our home is discovered.
dialogue.customQuestion: What do you guard the Citadel from?
dialogue.customReply: As maps to the Citadel have become more common, I fear it is only a matter of time until the church sends an army our way.

dialogue.who: Ryan. Blacksmith with the highest quality armor of Ascension.
dialogue.preference: Lead is popular with the nobles.
dialogue.customQuestion: What armor sells the best?
dialogue.customReply: People pay the most to protect their torso. Don't want to get poked in the squishy parts afterall.

dialogue.who: Haskof. I'm a blacksmith of incredible skill.
dialogue.preference: I could use anything made of gold.
dialogue.customQuestion: Where did you learn to blacksmith?
dialogue.customReply: The best way to master a craft is to have many teachers. I've learend from blacksmiths from Ayr to Ingress.

dialogue.who: Eltora, Academic of The Citadel and theoretical expert on all schools of magic.
dialogue.preference: I'm interested in literature.
dialogue.customQuestion: Could I learn magic?
dialogue.customReply: It takes decades of study and practice to perform even the most simple spells. So no, likely not.

dialogue.who: Cydan. I'm an apprentice mage.
dialogue.preference: Wands have become increasingly rare. Let me know if you find any.
dialogue.customQuestion: What do you study?
dialogue.customReply: Every mage begins studying crystals. Apprentices start with darker crystals, because they're safer and cheaper.

dialogue.who: Osian. I'm a soldier of the Redlands. Not much war out this way of course.
dialogue.preference: Do you have any fish on hand?
dialogue.customQuestion: How goes the war?
dialogue.customReply: We are in Hollow Lake. I don't think the Notting armies even know we exist.

dialogue.who: Mazag. I'm a blacksmith from the Orc Realm west of the desert.
dialogue.preference: I'm looking for lead ore or ingots.
dialogue.customQuestion: Why do Orcs value Iron so much.
dialogue.customReply: The Orc Realm is one of war. Wars are fought constantly over control of the major mines. Blacksmiths are kings. Iron is power.

dialogue.who: Ashig. I'm a hunter of the desert.
dialogue.preference: The bows are much stronger on this side of the desert. Have any for sale?
dialogue.customQuestion: Is it difficult to cross the desert?
dialogue.customReply: It takes an entire caravan of orcs to survive the dragons you humans have unleashed on the world.

dialogue.who: Urag. Fiercest warrior of my clan.
dialogue.preference: War hammers that can kill a dragon.
dialogue.customQuestion: Why do orcs value ingots so much?
dialogue.customReply: Why do humans value gold so much. There's not much you can do with it.

dialogue.who: Nayla. I travel the deserts for monsters and bring them here to sell.
dialogue.preference: I seek only the finest swords
dialogue.customQuestion: What is the most difficult monster to kill.
dialogue.customReply: The Juggernaut is more difficult than the dragon in my opinion, because they have no weak spots. Can take hours to take one down.
dialogue.jobSuccess: Flyers from the western deserts, as requested.
dialogue.jobFailure: I found none in the deserts. They may have migrated west earlier than I expected.

dialogue.who: Bodil. Fierce viking from the Fray.
dialogue.preference: I need a shield I could trust my life with.
dialogue.customQuestion: Do you raid villages?
dialogue.customReply: We did, before the Redlands began offering protection to the minor lords of the realm. Now we are mercenaries.
dialogue.jobSuccess: Those Redlands sailors barely know how to steer. Easy work for a viking.
dialogue.jobFailure: Those Redlands sailors have won this round, but I'll win the next.

dialogue.who: Gorm. Fierce warrior of Eldham Harbor.
dialogue.preference: If you have any powerful magic, I will find a way to put it to work.
dialogue.customQuestion: Do you raid villages?
dialogue.customReply: My days of pillaging small towns for a few copper coins are in the past now. I now only pillage for silver.

dialogue.who: I have no name. Only targets.
dialogue.preference: My swords are growing dull. Do you have anything sharp and deadly?
dialogue.customQuestion: Why the mask?
dialogue.customReply: Many years ago I let a target get the better of me. I was left disfigured, but the target was left dismembered.

dialogue.who: Cob. Just a dairy farmer.
dialogue.preference: I could use a hat.
dialogue.customQuestion: Does being a dairy farmer pay well?
dialogue.customReply: I once found a silver coin in a cow's udder.

dialogue.who: Remi. I fish the rivers of the Fray. Why are you so curious anyways?
dialogue.preference: Got any gloves merchant?
dialogue.customQuestion: Is something troubling you?
dialogue.customReply: Yes, I have an annoying merchant who won't stop asking me questions. Now are you gonna buy my fish or am I wasting my time?

dialogue.who: Stella. I fish in Hollow Lake.
dialogue.preference: Do you have gloves?
dialogue.customQuestion: What fish does Hollow Lake have?
dialogue.customReply: We have great Perch, Trout, but Cod is my favorite, usually sells the best too.

dialogue.who: Yarl. Just a poor beggar trying to survive.
dialogue.preference: Could you spare some coin?
dialogue.customQuestion: Does the Dragon of Kazuujan help the poor?
dialogue.customReply: The dragon only helps those who help her. Her terms were not acceptable to me.
dialogue.beg: Help a man down on his luck?

dialogue.who: Desmond. I'm a thief, but at times also a customer.
dialogue.preference: I'm looking for dark cloaks.
dialogue.customQuestion: Do you steal from merchants?
dialogue.customReply: The merchant guild and the thieves guild have an agreement at the moment, so merchants are off limits, mostly.
dialogue.jobSuccess: This what you were looking for boss?
dialogue.jobFailure: I was caught and imprisoned. Good thing their locks were so loose.

dialogue.who: Nadira. I buy what I want and steal what I need.
dialogue.preference: A quality dagger or two would do me good.
dialogue.customQuestion: Have you ever stolen from the Dragon of Kazuujan?
dialogue.customReply: There's no need to take such risks when nobles wear such loose fitting clothing filled with gold coins.
dialogue.jobSuccess: I picked only the finest of magical items to smuggle back.
dialogue.jobFailure: I was poisoned and they stole everything while I was asleep.

dialogue.who: Kraz. Guardian of the Dragon.
dialogue.preference: My axes are dull and broken. I need several more.
dialogue.customQuestion: Does the Dragon have many enemies?
dialogue.customReply: The dragon has gold. Anyone with gold has enemies.

dialogue.maskRequested: I feel like I needed this mask for something... No matter. What can you give me for it?
dialogue.who: Zehaan. The one and only. Do business with me and you too may become as wealthy as I.
dialogue.preference: Hats. Shoes. Anything stylish.
dialogue.customQuestion: How did you get wealthy?
dialogue.customReply: There's two secrets to getting rich. One of them is don't tell your secrets.

dialogue.maskRequested: I'm afraid can't sell this mask to you. It's for the Masquerade Ball.
dialogue.who: Kabir. Wealthy nobleman of Kazuujan.
dialogue.preference: Crystals. I like the ones with bright colors, but any will do.
dialogue.customQuestion: How did you get wealthy?
dialogue.customReply: Becoming friends with the Dragon of Kazuujan is the best business decision I've ever made.

dialogue.who: Omair. Mathematician of the Dragon.
dialogue.preference: Would you perhaps have a book I haven't yet read?
dialogue.customQuestion: What do you do for the dragon?
dialogue.customReply: I track her debts and calculate interest. The dragon herself is quite mathematically gifted so it is important I never make a mistake.

dialogue.who: Liv. I make candles.
dialogue.preference: Do you have any glass?
dialogue.customQuestion: What do you think about Hollow Lake?
dialogue.customReply: Too many strange people and nosy merchants.

dialogue.who: Gamila. I make the finest pottery in all the realm.
dialogue.preference: Have you brought any fruit, merchant?
dialogue.customQuestion: Is pottery a good way to store goods?
dialogue.customReply: Pottery is too expensive for practical storage, however you can often sell it for a profit unlike a sack or a crate.

dialogue.who: Naem. I'm a mason.
dialogue.preference: I need rocks, big and small.
dialogue.customQuestion: What are the best rocks
dialogue.customReply: Limestone followed by sandstone. The rest is just filler for most projects.

dialogue.who: Stanley. I'm a shoe maker.
dialogue.preference: Do you have any nuts?
dialogue.customQuestion: What do you think about Hollow Lake?
dialogue.customReply: It's boring. Just the way I like it.

dialogue.who: Fyaz. I travel the west searching for wealth and weapons.
dialogue.preference: Swords and potions.
dialogue.customQuestion: Why not travel the east instead?
dialogue.customReply: The east is too expensive, with too many laws, and too many wars.
dialogue.jobSuccess: Dragons are not so fierce if you know where to poke them.
dialogue.jobFailure: Dragons are the fiercest beasts in the realm. I was not able to win my battles.

dialogue.who: Kira.
dialogue.preference: Poison. Should be strong yet undetectable.
dialogue.customQuestion: Why do you wear a mask?
dialogue.customReply: Mind your own business merchant.

dialogue.who: Cassandra. I'm an alchemist.
dialogue.preference: Any mushrooms or snakes?
dialogue.customQuestion: What kind of ingredients are used in alchemy?
dialogue.customReply: Monster parts, althought animals make decent substitutes, with a base of plants and other botanicals.

dialogue.who: They call me the hag of Hollow Lake, but you can call me Margery.
dialogue.preference: Trolls from the west, make poisons the best.
dialogue.customQuestion: You don't look so well
dialogue.customReply: When you are three hundred years old, you will not look as well as I do.

dialogue.who: Bonnie. Just a poor old woman trying to survive.
dialogue.preference: Could you spare some clothes?
dialogue.customQuestion: Does the church help the poor in Ayr?
dialogue.customReply: Everybody helps the poor in Ayr. Helping each other is the only way to survive the winters.
dialogue.beg: I am dependent on the kindness of others. Could you please allow me to have this?

dialogue.who: Teagan. I fish the river that connect the Redlands and the Fray.
dialogue.preference: Any shoes or gloves?
dialogue.customQuestion: Does the Fray have different kinds of fish?
dialogue.customReply: Of course. They have crab, herring, and of course their world famous salmon. Sells quite well in the Redlands

dialogue.who: Connie. I fish the eastern seas.
dialogue.preference: Could use a quality knife or dagger.
dialogue.customQuestion: What is the best season to buy fish?
dialogue.customReply: Most fish breed during the season of Seed, which is the easiest time to catch them. Good season to buy.

dialogue.who: Midori. I'm a noblewoman of Shikyomo.
dialogue.preference: Anything from the mainland would be interesting to me.
dialogue.customQuestion: I heard people weren't allowed out of Shikyomo.
dialogue.customReply: Anybody is allowed to leave. Getting back home can be expensive however.

dialogue.who: Zyla. Cook and Barmaid of the infamous Rubbed Rock Tavern and Inn.
dialogue.preference: Any spices would be put to expert use if you can sell me any.
dialogue.customQuestion: Why is it called Rubbed Rock Tavern?
dialogue.customReply: It is tradition to rub the Ingress Rock. They say it used to be square, but thousands of years of rubbing has made it round.

dialogue.who: Savannah. I make tools, musical instruments, and other odd things.
dialogue.preference: I could use a bit of wood.
dialogue.customQuestion: What tools are the most expensive?
dialogue.customReply: Alchemy tools as they require exact precision and often difficult to obtain materials.

dialogue.who: Thomas. I'm a simple man looking for copper to spend at the racetrack.
dialogue.preference: They only accept copper coins at the racetrack. I've tried using chickens but they weren't having it.
dialogue.customQuestion: Have you been lucky with your wagers?
dialogue.customReply: Of course. Why just last week I almost won at 25 to 1 odds. Nobody is as lucky as me!
dialogue.beg: I'll pay you back after the next horse race. Nobody is as lucky as me!

dialogue.who: Blake Bailey, famed cook of Ascension, artist of the plate. After you have my food, you'll never enjoy anything else.
dialogue.preference: I am looking for the finest spices in the realm.
dialogue.customQuestion: What is the most valuable spice?
dialogue.customReply: Even a taste of Saffron will cost most peasants a year's wages.

dialogue.who: Koga. I fish the deep seas east of Kaichi.
dialogue.preference: We need wood for a new ship we are building.
dialogue.customQuestion: Do you pay the high tolls when you return home?
dialogue.customReply: Certainly not. I must share any fish I bring however, so I usually sell most of it before returning home.
dialogue.jobSuccess: Fish and other food from the Kaichi Islands.
dialogue.jobFailure: The pirates hit our ship just north of the port.

dialogue.who: Emerson Pearce. I fish the rivers of Notting.
dialogue.preference: Ropes or any other tools.
dialogue.customQuestion: When are fish prices low?
dialogue.customReply: Fish prices are lowest during seed, or as I call it spawn.

dialogue.who: Charlie Murphy. I feed the hungry mouths of Ayr.
dialogue.preference: I need good meat and seafood.
dialogue.customQuestion: Nice beard.
dialogue.customReply: Thanks.

dialogue.who: James Anker. I sail everywhere from Ingress Rock to Ascension.
dialogue.preference: Any potions or remedies?
dialogue.customQuestion: Does it bother you spending so much time out at sea?
dialogue.customReply: You get used to it. The hardest part is the food. There's only so much seafood and stale bread a man can take.
dialogue.jobSuccess: Wind was at our backs the whole way.
dialogue.jobFailure: A violent storm crashed our ship on the rocks of Kai.

dialogue.who: Sidney Collins. Sailor where a sailor is needed.
dialogue.preference: Do you have any good books?
dialogue.customQuestion: How is the life of a sailor?
dialogue.customReply: It's hard work, but when you love the ocean you have no other choice.
dialogue.jobSuccess: These spices smell awfully good.
dialogue.jobFailure: The spices were stolen when we were docked in Warg Bay.

dialogue.who: Jo, Baker of Riverton.
dialogue.preference: Have any eggs?
dialogue.customQuestion: What is the most expensive type of bread?
dialogue.customReply: A pullman loaf is nearly worth a copper coin to some.

dialogue.who: Caelan Gibson. Baker of Clydesdale.
dialogue.preference: I am looking for cheeses that pair well with my breads.
dialogue.customQuestion: How do you like Clydesdale?
dialogue.customReply: I lived my life in Eldham Harbor. I finally came out to Clydesdale for a festival and I simply never went home.

dialogue.who: Adeline Wilson, barmaid of The Wet Fish Inn and Tavern.
dialogue.preference: We need plates and bowls at the tavern.
dialogue.customQuestion: What do you think of the horse races?
dialogue.customReply: It's a fools game, but the lucky fools spend their winnings at my Tavern, so I won't complain.

dialogue.who: Henry Roberts, barkeep of The Cat and The Sword Tavern.
dialogue.preference: Do you have any glasses? All kinds will work.
dialogue.customQuestion: Why do they call it The Cat and The Sword?
dialogue.customReply: The owner claims he was once robbed by a cat. Said it had a fancy sword and even wore boots. He's not the sharpest tool in the shed.

dialogue.who: Ralph Gibson, barkeep of The Stoned Stag.
dialogue.preference: I could use a few statues for the tavern.
dialogue.customQuestion: Why do they call it the stoned stag?
dialogue.customReply: Story goes someone once shot a rock while hunting. He claimed he didn't miss, it was a stoned stag.

dialogue.who: Joey Buckets. I'm a butcher from Warg Bay.
dialogue.preference: Do you have any spices from Kai?
dialogue.customQuestion: That's a fancy mustache
dialogue.customReply: Thank you.

dialogue.who: Agnes. I'm a butcher.
dialogue.preference: I'll butcher any animals you bring me.
dialogue.customQuestion: What do you think about the church?
dialogue.customReply: I don't understand why they need so much gold. I get paid in copper and I at least provide something.

dialogue.who: Caden Kennedy, finest tailor in all the land.
dialogue.preference: Fine fabrics of course.
dialogue.customQuestion: Any advice for selling clothing?
dialogue.customReply: The best customers are the wealthy ones. They know the value of a finely crafted seem.

dialogue.who: Calpernia Wright. Captain of the finest ship to touch water.
dialogue.preference: Quality swords for me and my crew.
dialogue.customQuestion: Are pirates a problem?
dialogue.customReply: Not for my ship. The appearance of strength is the best defense.
dialogue.jobSuccess: No kingdoms navy can withstand the crew of the Dead Pearl!
dialogue.jobFailure: We sunk their ships, but the loot sank with it before we could reach it.

dialogue.who: Madeline Lane from Ascension.
dialogue.preference: Do you have any necklaces for sale?
dialogue.customQuestion: What do you think of The King?
dialogue.customReply: When I was a child, Ascension was little more than ruins from the great Revival War. He's transformed it into a bustling capitol city. He's a great man.

dialogue.who: Daria Holmes. I'm a noblewoman from Riverton.
dialogue.preference: I love flowers.
dialogue.customQuestion: Any advice for the Riverton Auction?
dialogue.customReply: Use the marketplace to find what different kinds of jewelry are selling for.

dialogue.who: Alya. Worshiper of the Elements.
dialogue.preference: This might sound strange, but do you have any rocks?
dialogue.customQuestion: What are the elements?
dialogue.customReply: Space, Sun, Moon, Ground, Water, Wind, Wood, Fire, Lightning. Many were adopted as gods during the age of Mythology.
dialogue.beg: I'll harmonize the nine elements in your favor if you gift me this as a favor.

dialogue.who: Simon. I'm a scribe and Devote of Divinity.
dialogue.preference: I'm only here to sell my books.
dialogue.customQuestion: How long does it take to copy a book?
dialogue.customReply: At least a year. But it is well worth it if the good word is read even once.

dialogue.who: Protus. I'm the greatest thinker of the realm.
dialogue.preference: I have no need for earthly possessions.
dialogue.customQuestion: Do you have any bits of wisdom for me?
dialogue.customReply: The unexamined life is not worth living.

dialogue.who: Jude Doyle, Herald for the Notting Dynasty.
dialogue.preference: Flags, banners, coat of arms.
dialogue.customQuestion: Do you have anything to declare today?
dialogue.customReply: You should hope not. When I do, it's always bad news.

dialogue.who: Radella Catherine.
dialogue.preference: I'm interested in amulets that could be of use to me.
dialogue.customQuestion: What do you think about Hollow Lake?
dialogue.customReply: People mind their own business, something you could learn from merchant.

dialogue.who: Aggie. I'm a herder.
dialogue.preference: Do you have any veggies?
dialogue.customQuestion: How did you get those horns?
dialogue.customReply: A mage was praticing his magic on me. It didn't go as planned. He later died trying to make himself immortal.

dialogue.who: Divoky.
dialogue.preference: Have any meat?
dialogue.customQuestion: You are a wolf?
dialogue.customReply: It was a mage practicing his magic on me. He later died trying to make himself immortal. Served him right.

dialogue.who: Corey. Just a simple farmer who enjoys a good game of myth.
dialogue.preference: Do you have any myth cards?
dialogue.customQuestion: What advice do you have for a fellow myth player?
dialogue.customReply: I recommend keeping a wet deck. Lots of water cards. Helps you build points that can't be destroyed.

dialogue.who: I am Xaviera; Dragon of Kazuujan; Banker of the West.
dialogue.preference: The bank only seeks gold and debtors.
dialogue.customQuestion: How rich is this bank?
dialogue.customReply: A third of the gold in the realm is here in this room with us.
